page.title: 18CHILBOLTON COMMON SURVEY
page.content:
This survey was carried out by Thomas Farrand, aged 11 years, as part of his project on Chilbolton Common for the Silver Award from the British Association for the Advancement of Science,July,1985.
DURING THE LAST TWO DAYS, 26TH. AND 27TH. MAY, SPRING BANK HOLIDAY, 1985, WE WENT DOWN TO THE COMMON TO DO A QUESTIONNAIRE TO FIND OUT WHY PEOPLE LIKE TO COME DOWN ON A HOLIDAY WEEKEND. WE ASKED 4 QUESTIONS, WITH 4 OR 5 CHOICES OF ANSWERS. THE WEATHER ON SUNDAY WAS CLOUDY WITH SUNNY SPELLS. ON MONDAY IT RAINED HEAVILY UNTIL 15.00 HOURS. WE INTERVIEWED 30 PEOPLE, 15 ON EACH DAY.
